helpdisplay the list of the command
help foobardisplay help about command foobar
cacls <file>display the ACLs of file
cacls <file> /g ftp:c david:c
grant change access to ftp and david
the possible permission letters are
n none
r read
c change
f full
the possible action letters are:
g grant rigths
p replace rights
cacls <file> <operations> /e edit the ACLs instead of reseting them
cacls <dir> <operations> /tchange recursively the ACLs of sub-directories and files
find "string" filesearch a string in a file
e.g. find "blockquote" *
/vdisplay all the lines not containing the string
/conly return the number of lines
/nprepend each line by its number in the file
findstr "string" filesearch a string in a file
perform a recursive search
findstr /m /s "foobar" *.*
the usual wild characters are supported
\<match the beginning of a word
\>match the end of a word
findstr /m /s "\<notes.htm\>" *.* returns the list of files containing the word notes.htm
/sperform a recursive search
/mprint only the file names
/nprint the line number for each matching line
/bthe string must be at the beginning of the line
/ethe string must be at the end of the line
/xthe string must be the whole line
/icase independent search
/lsearch literal string
/rsearch expression
/C:stringuse string as a literal search string
search for "granny" or "Smith" in MyFile.txt
findstr "granny Smith" MyFile.txt
search for "granny Smith" in MyFile.txt
findstr /C:"granny Smith" MyFile.txt
this is the same as the find command

/soperate recursively in the folder and subfolder
/dalso process folders
xcopycopy a directory
e.g. xcopy dir_source/data dir_target/data /S /E
if dir_target/data does not exist, xcopy will ask if its must create a file or a directory (answer a directory)
/acopy only files with the archive attribute (keep the archive attribute of the source file)
/d:dd/mm/aacopy only files more recent than the indicated date
/ecopy all the subdirectories even if empty (to use with /s)
/mcopy only files with the archive attribute (remove the archive attribute of the source file)
/pask for confirmation before each file copy
/scopy non empty directories and subdirectories (without this flag, xcopy copies only a directory)
/vcheck each data recording
/wdisplay a prompt before copying the file (the copy can be cancelled with )
copycopy a file
/vcheck that sectors written on disk are correct
/afor a source file, the data are copied up to the first end-of-file mark()
for a target file, a end-of-file mark is added as the last character in the file
/bfor a source file, the file must be entirely copied including the end-of-file marks
for a target file, does not add a end-of-file mark at the end of the file
copy foo+bar[+…] targetconcatenate the source files into a single target file
copy foo+bar[+…]concatenate the files into foo
copy *.suf targetconcatenate the files in target
copy *.ref+*.tex *.docconcatenate the file pairs *.ref+*.tex in files *.doc
copy *.ref+*.tex targetconcatenate all the files into target
copy foo.bar+*.barconcatenate all the files into foo.bar
